text: Abdulrazak Gurnah (born 20 December 1948) is a Tanzanian-born British novelist. He moved to the United Kingdom as a refugee in the 1960s. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2021. Most of his novels talked about colonialism and its impact on refugees. ==References== Category:1948 births Category:Living people Category:Naturalised citizens of the United Kingdom Category:British novelists Category:Tanzanian writers
title: Abdulrazak Gurnah
